org.remoteHome

Class RemoteHomeConnectionException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • org.remoteHome.RemoteHomeConnectionException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class RemoteHomeConnectionException
extends java.lang.Exception
    This class represents the communication errors with the harware.It is thrown by the RemoteHomeCommunicator class, it means by the communication layer of the API. Usual case could be e.g. that the hardware device didn't answer to the command - it means, that the communication with the device is not established, either, because e.g. the device is powered off or the range between the transceiver and the device is too large.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • UNKNOWN_HOST

        public static final int UNKNOWN_HOST
        This constant represent the case, when the API doesn't connect to the transceiver, because the host was not found. If you are connecting from the remote machine using hostname, make sure, that hostname could be resolved.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONNECTION

        public static final int CONNECTION
        This constant represent the case, when the API doesn't connect to the transceiver. If you are connecting e.g. to localhost, make sure, that ser2net is listening on localhost, and that it is listening on the port, you expect. Also please check, that the ser2net is already running.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_FROM_DEVICE

        public static final int ERROR_FROM_DEVICE
        The device send back ERROR. Please check the protocol document.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NO_RESPONSE_FROM_DEVICE

        public static final int NO_RESPONSE_FROM_DEVICE
        The device didn't answer to the command. Is the device powered? Is the device in the range of transceiver.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INVALID_PARAMETER

        public static final int INVALID_PARAMETER
        The supplied parameter is invalid.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • UNKNOWN_PORT

        public static final int UNKNOWN_PORT
        The supplied parameter is invalid.
